events.name: Tuesday Backgammon Tournament at the Manhattan Games Center
events.description:
Join us for a night of backgammon at our weekly tournament.

On Tuesdays at The Manhattan Games Center we will be serving light snacks (cheese and crackers, crudites and dip, salads, fresh fruit, etc.) Cake, cookies, coffee, tea, wine, beer and soft drinks will also be served. We will close around 11:00 pm.

Evening session and refreshment fee - $20, cash only. We do not accept credit cards.

Tournament format this week:

$5entry, with $5 re-entries to 16. 5 point matches.
Prize distribution to 1st and 2nd place.
100% Return

OR

Our alternate tournament format:

Play in John Barnett's popular Chouette tournament. If you're not familiar with playing in a Chouette, this is a fun way to learn.
Entry fee: $10

Please bring your board if you have one (if you don't, we have a limited amount on hand).

If you do not wish to play in either of the tournaments you are still welcome to join us for social play or chouettes. Please note, there is a $20 session and refreshment fee for all.

Please RSVP to this meetup if you’ll be attending so that we can plan accordingly.

We look forward to seeing you.

//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\

Free on-street parking, right in front of the building, starts at 6:00 pm. There is metered parking all-day until 7:00 pm. The subway is two blocks away.

If you would like to bring your group or Meetup to any of these nights let Lynn know. She can be reached at [masked] or (408)[masked].

events.name: Tuesday Backgammon Tournament at the Manhattan Games Center
events.description:
UPDATED ANNOUNCEMENT

I'm very happy to announce that we had our first post pandemic meetup last night. Although it was a small group, we had fun and it was great to see each other again after a very long 14 months. So nice to be able to play in person! We will continue to have our weekly Meetup onTuesdays at the Manhattan Games Center located within the Cavendish Club, 177 East 87th St, Suite 302A
New York, NY 10128

Please note that you must be fully vaccinated to attend and you will need to show proof of this. Masks must be worn.

Also, at this time we are not allowed to serve food. We will have limited refreshments and you are welcome to bring food with you or order in. There are plenty of restaurants in the neighborhood that deliver.

We would like to know your thoughts about what type of play you would like for our first meetup. We're considering starting with our $5 single elimination tournament with re-entries to 16. If eliminated, you will be able to have casual play or a chouette. Your choice.

We will close around 11:00 pm.

Evening session and refreshment fee - $15, cash only. We do not accept credit cards.

Tournament format this week:

$5entry, with $5 re-entries to 16. 5 point matches.
Prize distribution to 1st and 2nd place.
100% Return

Please RSVP to this meetup if you’ll be attending so that we can plan accordingly. And if you have any suggestions or questions please feel free to contact us.

Looking forward to seeing all of you!

~Lynn
[masked]

//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\//\

Free on-street parking, right in front of the building, starts at 6:00 pm. There is metered parking all-day until 7:00 pm. The subway is two blocks away.

If you would like to bring your group or Meetup to any of these nights let Lynn know. She can be reached at [masked] or (408)[masked].

events.name: Let's play word games in person!

group.name: NYNJA Word Puzzles and Word Games

events.description:
Let's play word games! Buy something to eat or drink and come upstairs.

No outside food or drink.

Mask wearing and any other rules of the establishment. You're good at rules. They're in all the games!
events.how_to_find_us: buy something and then go upstairs one flight to the seating area

events.name: Board Games with Strangers

group.name: The Brooklyn Board Games Meetup Group

events.description:
Love board games? Looking for someone to play with or something new to play? Come play games with us!

Every Saturday night we run Games With Strangers. Grab a drink or dinner, meet some new people, and learn a new game. Our game expert will teach you our featured games for the night and make sure that things are running smoothly. Come be a part of our community!

NOTE: Due to the pandemic (the slow, creeping nightmare that has become our lives, not the award winning board game) we respectfully ask that attendees make sure to RSVP to Games With Strangers. If we do not have enough RSVPs to fill a game by noon on game day, that night's event will be cancelled, so sign up early and let's break some attendance records!
events.how_to_find_us: On Court Street between Sackett and Union
